title: What type of model of communication is this? Last Sunday, Maria, and her family attended the Holy Mass. They were so attentive during the homily. - Quora
tags: The Holy Mass (liturgical celebration of the Eucharist)

response.answer_text: The homily is the only instruction that most adults get on the wisdom of the Bible, & how it applies in our daily life. This family heard what they needed to hear. Catholic Answer In Acts, xx, 11, we meet the term omilesas[homily]; here it is used, for the first time, to signify a sermon to the Christians in connection with the breaking of bread: it was evidently an informal discourse, or exposition of doctrine, for we are told that St. Paul “talked a long time… until daylight”. Homily

It appears that some folks have misunderstood the question. What you describe is best defined as a Linear Model of Communication. Even though the reciever may be actively decoding and internalizing the message, because your narrative does not express that feedback or interaction with the sender took place, the communication takes place in one direction, therefore it is linear.
